content.value: Welcome to Power Maker AI, your AI assistant for Dynamics 365 CRM. This documentation will guide you through everything you need to know‚Äîfrom getting started to using our AI-powered models to accelerate CRM development, analysis, and automation.
Whether you're a CRM developer, consultant, tester, or business manager, this guide is designed to help you get the most out of Power Maker AI.
Power Maker AI is a web-based AI assistant designed specifically for users working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM. It helps you:

value: Design custom entities and fields tailored to new or ongoing CRM projects, allowing seamless prototyping of CRM customizations.
Analyze plugin trace logs in a human-readable format.
Interact with CRM through a conversational AI assistant for data operations and diagnostics.

content.value: Power Maker AI leverages cutting-edge language models and CRM-specific logic to interpret your natural language inputs and turn them into meaningful CRM actions.

‚ö†Ô∏è  Note: Power Maker AI does not directly connect to your CRM environment unless explicitly configured. All data operations and configurations are currently simulated or require manual export/import.
Visit https://chat.powermaker.ai and log in with your user account. New users may be prompted to create an account.
üìù Users can log in using their Google account or sign up manually with an email ID and password.
You can start working by selecting one of the available models from the sidebar:

value: CRM Customizations
Plugin Tracing
CRM Expert

content.value: Each model is tailored to solve a different problem‚Äîsee the next section for a breakdown.
Use natural language or UI-based prompts depending on the model.

content.label: Examples:
value: ‚ÄúCreate a custom entity for API Configuration‚Äù
‚ÄúShow plugin errors from the last 7 days‚Äù
‚ÄúUpdate all contacts in Delhi to Inactive‚Äù

content.label: Outputs can include:
value: CRM schema mock-ups
Exception trace analysis
Data operation summaries
Configuration exports (coming soon)

content.value: Most outputs can be copied or downloaded. You‚Äôll soon be able to directly push changes to your CRM (integration in development).
Purpose: Helps you quickly design custom entities and fields using simple prompts or structured controls.

content.label: Capabilities:
value: Create entity prototypes
Define fields and datatypes
Preview configurations before exporting

content.label: Limitations:
value: No live deployment to CRM (yet)
Does not handle advanced logic (e.g., business rules, workflows)

content.value: Purpose: Use natural language to query plugin trace logs and receive readable diagnostics.

content.label: Capabilities:
value: Filter logs by entity, date, error status, etc.
Translate raw logs into clean summaries and exceptions
View structured trace tables

content.label: Limitations:
value: Requires logs to be available in the system or uploaded
Works best with standard plugin trace formats

content.value: Purpose: Your all-in-one conversational AI for CRM data tasks, config queries, and error diagnostics.

content.label: Capabilities:
value: Perform CRUD-like operations through text (simulation)
Suggest configuration steps
Answer questions like a Dynamics consultant

content.label: Limitations:
value: Requires clear CRM context for deeper operations
Best for guided exploration, not high-volume automation

content.value: Once you‚Äôre familiar with the models, you can explore each in detail. Use the navigation menu to dive deeper into individual features, input formats, and best practices.
üí¨ Need help? Reach out at support@powermaker.ai or via the in-app chat.
